review: The Fire TV Stick is working well now, but it almost made it back to Amazon. I have a very powerful modem and router in my home because that is where my office.is for my job in sales. Even having the Fire Stick just about on top of the router, this Stick had lots of trouble connecting and kept dropping my network. Every thing else in my home was working just fine to include the $100 Amazon Fire system. It lost the network constantly when  first being installed. After 10 times trying to download all of the information, I gave up and started to wrap up the Fire Stick to send back to Amazon. Luckily, I had time to sleep on it to get a  better handle on things and I tried it one more time and it worked fine. Go figure. I guess threatening the little stick was all it took. I am sure it will work fine now. I'll give it 20 days. No problems for now.
author: Dante Capriotti

review: Hmmm.... the Fire TV Stick, what a handy little gadget. I am a Netflix watcher who use to use my son's Play Station 3 for streaming.  The commercial for the Fire TV Stick left me curious about it's functionality so, I purchased it.  First, I like how compact it is.  The small device attaches to my television HDMI port.  There's also a cord that attaches to the stick which has to be plugged into outlet.  There's so much less space used around the tv than Fire TV Sticks bulky counterpart Play Station 3.  Second, this little device streams programs other than Netflix, but also Hulu, ESPN, etc.  Kudos to Amazon and the inventor of this compact, innovative little streaming device.
